dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIANCA STRATFORD, a beautiful sophomore, stands facing th mirror, applying lipstick.  Her less extraordinary, but  still cute friend, CHASTITY stands next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you change your hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might wanna think about it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave the girls' room and enter the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca is immediately greeted by an admiring crowd, both  boys and girls alike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adoring) Hey, Bianca.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awesome shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The greetings continue as Chastity remains wordless and  unaddressed by her side.  Bianca smiles proudly,  acknowledging her fans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON JAMES, a clean-cut, easy-going senior with an ope farm-boy face, sits facing Miss Perky, an impossibly chee guidance counselor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you won't find Padua any  different than your old school.  Same  little asswipe mother-fuckers  everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her plastic smile never leaves her face.  Cameron fidgets his chair uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Any questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so, ma'am

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then go forth.  Scoot   I've got  deviants to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron rises to leave and makes eye contact with PATRICK VERONA, a sullen-looking bad ass senior who waits outside Perky's door.  His slouch and smirk let us know how cool is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Perky looks down at her file and up at Patrick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Patrick Verona.  I see we're making our  visits a weekly ritual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a withering glance. He answers with a charm smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says here you exposed yourself to a  group of freshmen girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a bratwurst.  I was eating  lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the teeth of your zipper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She motions for Patrick to enter her office and Cameron  shuffles out the door, bumping into MICHAEL ECKMAN, a lan brainy senior who will either end up a politician or game show host.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You the new guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So they tell me...

dialogues.text: C'mon.  I'm supposed to give you the  tour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) So -- which Dakota you from?

dialogues.text: North, actually.  How'd you   ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was kidding. People actually live  there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  A couple.  We're outnumbered by  the cows, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many people were in your old  school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many people go here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couple thousand. Most of them evil

dialogues.text: Prom posters adorn the wall. Michael steers Cameron throu the crowd as he points to various cliques.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got your basic beautiful people.  Unless they talk to you first, don't  bother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beautiful people pass, in full jock/cheerleader  splendor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Those 're your cowboys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several Stetson-wearing, big belt buckle. Wrangler guys   walk by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I'm used to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but these guys have never seen a  horse.  They just jack off to Clint  Eastwood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass an espresso cart with a group of teens huddled  around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) To the right, we have the Coffee Kids.   Very edgy.  Don't make any sudden  movements around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael continues the tour

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And these delusionals are the White  Rastae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several white boys in dreadlocks and Jamaican knit berets lounge on the grass.  A cloud of pot smoke hovers above t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Big Marley fans.  Think they're black.   Semi-political, but mostly, they watch a  lot of Wild Kingdom, if you know what I  mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael waves to DEREK, the one with the longest dreads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Derek - save some for after lunch, bub?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very stoned) Michael, my brother, peace

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where do you fit in all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loud music and loud students.  Michael sits with a group studious-looking teens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Future MBAs-  We're all Ivy League,  already accepted.  Someday I'll be  sipping Merlot while those guys --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to the table of jocks, as they torture various  passers-by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) are fixing my Saab.  Yuppie greed is  back, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron stops listening as BIANCA walks by, and we go SLO MO.  Pure and perfect, she passes Cameron and Michael  without a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron is smitten

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That girl -- I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You burn, you pine, you perish?

dialogues.text: Who is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca Stratford.  Sophomore. Don't  even think about it

dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could start with your haircut, but it  doesn't matter.  She's not allowed to  date until her older sister does.  And  that's an impossibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A room full of bored seniors doodle and scare off into sp MS. BLAISE, the one-step-away-from-medication English  Teacher, tries to remember what she's talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then.  Oh, yes.  I guess that  does it for our analysis of The Old Man  and the Sea.  Any other comments? (with dread) Kat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat, the girl we saw as we entered the school, slowly cak off her glasses and speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't we just read the Hardy Boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This book is about a guy and his  fishing habit.  Not exactly a crucial  topic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other students roll their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Frankly, I'm baffled as to why we still  revere Hemingway.  He was an abusive,  alcoholic misogynist who had a lot of  cats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY DORSEY, a well-muscled jock with great cheekbones,  makes fun of her from his row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As opposed to a bitter self-righteous  hag who has no friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few giggles.  Kat ignores him.  A practiced gesture

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough, Mr. Dorsey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really gets fired up now

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess the school board thinks because  Hemingway's male and an asshole, he's  worthy of our time

dialogues.text: She looks up at Ms. Blaise, who is now fighting with her  pill box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother Goose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class titters.  Kat wears an expression of intoleranc

dialogues.text: Kat now sits before Miss Perky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katarina Stratford.  My, my.  You've  been terrorizing Ms. Blaise again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Expressing my opinion is not a  terrorist action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yes, compared to your other  choices of expression this year, today's  events are quite mild.  By the way,  Bobby Rictor's gonad retrieval operation  went quite well, in case you're  interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still maintain that he kicked himself  in the balls.  I was merely a spectator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The point is Kat -- people perceive you  as somewhat ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat smiles at her, daring her to say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tempestuous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ... I believe "heinous bitch" is the  term used most often.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grimaces, as if she's referring to a medical conditio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You might want to work on that

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat rises from her chair with a plastic smile matching th counselor's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As always, thank you for your excellent  guidance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca ignores the droning teacher as she writes a note i big flowing handwriting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realize the language of Mr.  Shakespeare makes him a bit daunting,  but I'm sure you're all doing your best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca folds the note and passes it behind her with a fli of her hair to CHASTITY.  Chastity opens the note and rea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Ms. Stratford, do you care to comment  on what you've read so far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca looks up and smiles the smile of Daddy's little gi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.text: MANDELLA. a waif-like senior girl who sits off to the sid trying to slit her wrist with the plastic spiral on her  notebook, looks up and raises her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah, I read it all

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole play^

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She raises a challenging eyebrow.  The stunned teacher  doesn't answer and goes to call on the next student.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mandella and Kat sit down in the quiet corner. They are  eating a carton of yogurt with gusto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your sister is so amazingly without.  She'll never read h She has no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat attacks

dialogues.text: Kat's attention is caught by Patrick as he walks by with friends, lighting up a cigarette.  Mandella notices her  staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick Verona   Random skid.

dialogues.text: He always look so

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realize that the men of this fine  institution are severely lacking, but  killing yourself so you can be with  William Shakespeare is beyond the scope  of normal teenage obsessions.  You're  venturing far past daytime talk show  fodder and entering the world of those  who need very expensive therapy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But imagine the things he'd say during  sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thinks a minute

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, say you do it.  You kill  yourself, you end up in wherever you end  up and he's there.  Do you really think  he's gonna wanna dace a ninety pound  compulsive who failed volleyball?

dialogues.text: Joey Dorsey?  Perma-shit-grin.  I wish  I could say he's a moron, but he's  number twelve in the class.  And a  model.  Mostly regional stuff, but he's  rumored to have a big tube sock ad  coming out.

dialogues.text: The BELL rings, and the cowboys stand and spit into their empty bean cans.   Cameron and Michael rise as Cameron tr to catch a glimpse of Bianca as she walks back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Kat and Mandella walk toward Kat's car.  Joey pulls up  beside her in his Viper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He zooms away as Kat yanks open the door of her Dart.   Mandella ties a silk scarf around her head, as if they're a convertible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The people at this school are so  incredibly foul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could always go with me.  I'm sure  William has some friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch Joey's car as he slows next to Bianca and  Chastity as they walk toward the school bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need a ride, ladies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca and Chastity can't get in Joey's car fast enough. pulls away with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHARON STRATFORD, attractive and focused, sits in front o her computer, typing quickly.   A shelf next to her holds several bodice-ripper romance novels, bearing her name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Undulating with desire, Adrienne  removes her crimson cape, revealing her  creamy --"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope dinner's ready because I only have ten minutes bef Mrs. Johnson squirts out a screamer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: What's this?  It says Sarah Lawrence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatches it away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I got in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a synonym for throbbing?

dialogues.text: Sarah Lawrence is on the other side of  the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.text: I thought we decided you were going to  school here.  At U of 0.

dialogues.text: You decided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there even a question that we want  her to stay?

dialogues.text: Kat gives Bianca an evil look then smiles sweetly at

dialogues.text: Swollen...turgid.

dialogues.text: Bianca glares at Kat then turns to Walter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now don't get upset. Daddy, but there's  this boy... and I think he might ask...

dialogues.text: No! You're not dating until your sister  starts dating.  End of discussion.

dialogues.text: What if she never starts dating?

dialogues.text: (in unison, by  rote) The sound of a fifteen-year-old in  labor.

dialogues.text: Tumescent!

dialogues.text: Cameron sits with an empty chair beside him.  Bianca arri in a flurry of blonde hair.

dialogues.text: Can we make this quick?  Roxanne  Korrine and Andrew Barrett are having an  incredibly horrendous public break- up  on the quad.  Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're asking me out.  That's so cute.   What's your name again?

dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, it's my fault -- we didn't have  a proper introduction ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing is, Cameron -- I'm at the  mercy of a particularly hideous breed of  loser.  My sister.  I can't date until  she does.

dialogues.text: Seems like she could get a date easy  enough...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fingers a lock of her hair.  He looks on, dazzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem is, she's completely anti-social.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unsolved mystery.  She used to be  really popular when she started high  school, then it was just like she got  sick of it or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a shame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches out and touches his arm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gosh, if only we could find Kat a  boyfriend...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see what I can do.

dialogues.text: Cameron smiles, having no idea how stupid he is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A frog is being torn asunder by several prongs and picks. Michael and Cameron go for the spleen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in school for one day and you  ask out the most beautiful girl?  Do you  have no concept of the high school  social code?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron grins away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I teach her French, get to know her,  dazzle her with charm and she falls in  love with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unlikely, but even so, she still can't  go out with you.  So what's the point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron motions with his head toward Patrick, a few lab  tables away.  He's wearing biker glasses instead of goggl as he tries to revive his frog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) You wanna go out with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others at the lab table raise their eyebrows

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatient) No - he could wrangle with the sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael smiles.  Liking the intrigue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think he'll do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems like he thrives on danger

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kidding.  He's a criminal.  I heard  he lit a state trooper on fire.  He just  got out of Alcatraz...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They always let felons sit in on Honors  Biology?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious, man, he's whacked.  He  sold his own liver on the black market  so he could buy new speakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget his reputation.  Do you think  we've got a plan or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she actually say she'd go out with  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I just said

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael processes this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, if you do go out with Bianca,  you'd be set.  You'd outrank everyone.   Strictly A-list.  With me by your side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you hated those people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- I've gotta have a few clients  when I get to Wall Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cowboy flicks the frog's heart into one of the Coffee  Kid's latte.  Cameron presses on, over the melee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So now all we gotta do is talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to Patrick, who now makes his frog hump another frog, with full-on sound effects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll let you handle that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys and a few stray girls nail their pieces of wood

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael sits next to PEPE, a Coffee Kid, who holds out hi jacket like the men who sell watches in the subway.  Insi several bags of coffee hang from hooks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people like the Colombian, but it  all depends on your acidity preference.   Me?  I prefer East African and  Indonesian.  You start the day with a  Sumatra Boengie or maybe and Ethiopian  Sidamo in your cup, you're that much  farther ahead than someone drinkin'  Cosia Rican or Kona -- you know what I  mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael nods solemnly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick sits at a table with Scurvy, making something tha looks like a machete out of a two-by-four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron approaches, full of good-natured farm boy cheer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, there

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In response, Patrick brandishes a loud POWER TOOL in his  direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron slinks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Later, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael watches, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey and his pals take turns drawing boobs onto a cafeter tray with a magic marker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael walks up and sits between them, casual as can be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you lost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope - just came by to chat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't chat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, actually, I thought I'd run an  idea by you.  You know, just to see if  you're interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs Michael by the side of the head, and proceeds to draw a penis on his cheek with the magic marker.   Michae suffers the indignity and speaks undaunted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimacing) Hear me out.  You want Bianca don't  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey sits back and cackles at his drawing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) But she can't go out with you because  her sister is this insane head case and  no one will go out with her. right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this conversation have a purpose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what you need to do is recruit a guy  who'll go out with her.  Someone who's  up for the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael points to Patrick, who makes a disgusted face at turkey pot pie before he rises and throws it at the garba can, rather than in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy?  I heard he ate a live duck once.  Everything b the beak and the feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey turns to look at Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in it for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, nothin' man   Purely good will  on my part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rises to leave and turns to the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I have a dick on my face, don't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael stands at the sink, trying to scrub Joey's artwor off his face as Cameron watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got him involved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like we had a choice?  Besides -- when  you let the enemy think he's  orchestrating the battle, you're in a  position of power. We let him pretend  he's calling the shots, and while he's  busy setting up the plan, you have time  to woo Bianca.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron grins and puts an arm around him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're one brilliant guy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael pulls back, noticing other guys filing in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey - I appreciate gratitude as much as the next guy, but it's not gonna do you any good to be known as New Kid Who Embraces Guys In The Bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron pulls back and attempts to posture himself in a  manly way for the others, now watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat and Mandella pick apart their pad thai.  Mandella is  smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he has this huge raging fit about  Sarah Lawrence and insists that I go to  his male-dominated, puking frat boy,  number one golf team school. I have no  say at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William would never have gone to a  state school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William didn't even go to high school

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's never been proven

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither has his heterosexuality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mandella replies with a look of ice.  Kat uses the moment stub out Mandella's cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I appreciate your efforts toward a  speedy death, but I'm consuming. (pointing at her  food) Do you mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I was Bianca, it would be, "Any  school you want, precious.  Don't forget  your tiara."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both look up as Patrick enters.  He walks up to the  counter to place his order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mandella leans toward Kat with the glow of fresh gossip

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janice Parker told me he was a roadie  for Marilyn Manson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick nods at them as he takes his food outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janice Parker is an idiot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick sits before Miss Perky, eating his Thai food

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at chart) I don't understand, Patrick.  You  haven't done anything asinine this week.   Are you not feeling well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touch of the flu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm at a loss, then.  What should we  talk about? Your year of absence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles his charming smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout your sex life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tolerates his comment with her withering glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we discuss your driving need  to be a hemorrhoid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's to discuss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't abused, you aren't stupid,  and as far as I can tell, you're only  slightly psychotic -- so why is it that  you're such a fuck-up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know -- there's the prestige  of the job title... and the benefits  package is pretty good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bell RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  Go do something repugnant and  give us something to talk about next  week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several pairs of tutors and students sit at the various  desks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mandella sits with TREVOR, a White Rasta.  She attempts t get him to do geometry, but he stares at her, as if smitt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it's really easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a freedom fighter. Be proud,  sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mandella sets down her pencil and closes the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rotely) It's Mandella with two L's.  I am not  related to Nelson Mandela.  I am not a  political figure.  I do not live in  South Africa.  My parents just spent a  few too many acid trips thinking they  were revolutionaries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you freed our people

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your "people" are white, suburban high  school boys who smoke too much hemp.  I  have not freed you, Trevor. (grabbing his arm  dramatically) Only you can free yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACROSS THE ROOM Bianca and Cameron sit side by side, cozy can be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'esc ma tete. This is my head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  See?  You're ready for the  quiz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to know how to say that  though.  I want to know useful things.   Like where the good stores are.  How  much does champagne cost?  Stuff like  Chat.  I have never in my life had to  point out my head to someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because it's such a nice one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shuts her book and puts on a seductive smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) How is our little Find the Wench A Date  plan progressing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's someone I think might be  --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca's eyes light up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron and Bianca lean against the wall -inconspicuously Bianca plays it cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a sign when he walks by.  And  don't point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bell RINGS.  Kids flood past.  Then Patrick saunters with Scurvy.  Cameron nudges Bianca.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of desperation, Cameron awkwardly lunges across  Patrick's path.  Patrick shoves him back against the wall without a thought.  Cameron lands in a THUD at Bianca's  feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess he didn't see me  (calling after  Patrick)  Some other time --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca watches Patrick, a wicked gleam in  her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, he's repulsive. He's so  perfect!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several volleyball games are being played.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey and a member of his hulking entourage, approach  Patrick, who still manages to look cool, even in gym  clothes.  They pull him aside roughly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging them  off) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey points

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY See that girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick follows his line of vision to Kat as she spikes t ball into some poor cowboy's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat wins the game and high fives the others, who are scar of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two legs, nice rack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, whatever.  I want you to go out  with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Sparky.  I'll get right on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just said

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need money to take a girl out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you'd go out with her if you had  the cake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick stares at Joey deadpan.  His dislike for the guy  obvious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Yeah, I'd take her to Europe if I had  the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it, Verona.  I pick up the tab,  you do the honors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna pay me to take out some  girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't date her sister until that one  gets a boyfriend.  And that's the catch.   She doesn't want a boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty bucks each time you take her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take a girl like that out on  twenty bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick raises an eyebrow, urging him up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Take it or leave it.  This isn't a  negotiation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty, and you've got your man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick walks away with a smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat and the rest of the team go through a grueling practi session.  Kat spares no one as she whips the ball all ove the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick sits on the bleachers nearby, watching.  A cigare dangles from his mouth.  His pal, SCURVY is next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. CHAPIN, the coach, blows the WHISTLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proudly)  Good run, Stratford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat nods in response, and the girls leave the field. Patr hops down to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Girlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat stops and turns slowly to look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)  I mean Wo-man.  How ya doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles brightly) Sweating like a pig, actually.  And  yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a way to get a guy's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mission in life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands there undaunted, hand on hip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Obviously, I've struck your fancy. So,  you see, it worked.  The world makes  sense again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick's eyes narrow.  He steps closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pick you up Friday, then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right.  Friday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATRICK backs up a little.  He uses his most seductive to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The night I take you to places you've  never been before.  And back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like where?  The 7-Eleven on Burnside?   Do you even know my name, screwboy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know a lot more than that

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doubtful.  Very doubtful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks away quickly, leaving him standing alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after her) You're no bargain either, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scurvy appears at his side

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I guess the Jeep won't be getting a  new Blaupunkt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACROSS THE FIELD Cameron and Michael watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He took the bait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat washes her face at the sink.  Bianca appears behind h and attempts to twist Kat's hair into a chignon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wacks Bianca away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever considered a new look? I  mean, seriously, you could have some  potential buried under all this  hostility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat pushes past her into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have the potential to smack the crap  out of you if you don't get out of my  way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you at least start wearing a bra?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat SLAMS her door in response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick, Scurvy and some other randoms head for the exit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCURVY You up for a burger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick looks in his wallet.  It's empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat stands at her locker, gathering her books.  Patrick  appears at her side, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat doesn't answer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)  You hate me don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really think you warrant that  strong an emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then say you'll spend Dollar Night at  the track with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why would I do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on -- the ponies, the flat beer,  you with money in your eyes, me with my  hand on your ass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You -- covered in my vomit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven-thirty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slams her locker shut and walks away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat emerges from a music store carrying a bag of CDs in teeth, and fumbling through her purse with both hands.  S finds her keys and pulls them out with a triumphant tug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up and finds Patrick sitting on the hood of her car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice ride. Vintage fenders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat takes the bag out of her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you following me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in the laundromat. I saw your  car. Thought I'd say hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets in and starts the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a big talker, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends on the topic. My fenders don't  really whip me into a verbal frenzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to pull out, and is blocked by Joey's Viper,  which pulls up perpendicular to her rear and parks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey and his groupies emerge and head for the liquor stor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Hey -- do you mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue on into the store.  Kat stares at them in  disbelief...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then BACKS UP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her vintage fenders CRASH into the door of Joey's preciou Viper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick watches with a delighted grin Joey races out of t liquor store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)  You fucking bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat pulls forward and backs into his car again.  Smiling  sweetly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter paces as Kat sits calmly on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My insurance does not cover PMS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then tell them I had a seizure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this about Sarah Lawrence? You  punishing me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were punishing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't we agree on this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're making decisions for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a parent, that's my right

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what I want doesn't matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're eighteen.  You don't know what  you want.  You won't know until you're  forty-five and you don't have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emphatic) I want to go to an East Coast school! I  want you to trust me to make my own  choices.  I want --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter's BEEPER goes off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ!  I want a night to go by that  I'm not staring a contraction in the  face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks out, leaving Kat stewing on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick shuts his graffiti-encrusted locker, revealing  Joey's angry visage, glowering next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I shell out fifty, I expect  results.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching the bitch trash my car doesn't  count as a date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got her under control. She just acts  crazed in public to keep up the image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey sees through the bluff

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me put it to you this way, if you  don't get any action, I don't get any  action.  So get your ass on hers by the  end of the week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey starts to walk off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just upped my price

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred bucks a date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget her sister, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey thinks for a frustrated moment, PUNCHES  the locker, then peels another fifty out of his wallet with a  menaci scowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better hope you're as smooth as you  think you are, Verona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick takes the money with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron runs a sentence past Bianca.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: La copine et I 'ami?  La diferance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "copine" is someone you can count on.   An "ami" is someone who makes promises  he can't keep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron closes the French book

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got something on your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I counted on you to help my cause. You  and that thug are obviously failing.   Aren't we ever going on our date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He melts

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have my word.  As a gentleman

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She touches his hand. He blushes at her praise and watche her toss her hair back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appreciative) How do you get your hair to look like  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eber's Deep Conditioner every two days.   And I never, ever use a blowdryer  without the diffuser attachment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron nods with interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I read an article about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca looks surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick stands at the sink, washing his hands Michael and Cameron cower in the corner, watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without turning  around)  Say it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearing his  throat)  What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever the hell it is you're standin'  there waitin' to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron bravely steps forward

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wanted to talk to you about the  plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick turns toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The situation is, my man Cameron here  has a major jones for Bianca Stratford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it with this chick?  She have  three tits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron starts to object, but Michael holds up a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I speak correctly when I say  that Cameron's love is pure.  Purer than  say -- Joey Dorsey's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorsey can plow whoever he wants. I'm  just in this for the cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron starts choking at the thought of Joey plowing his beloved Bianca.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where we can help you.  With  Kat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Dorsey can get the girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick, Pat, you're not looking at the  big picture.  Joey's just a pawn. We set  this whole thing up so Cameron can get  the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick smiles.  He likes the idea of Joey being a pawn i this game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two are gonna help me tame the wild  beast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning)  We're your guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he means that strictly in a non-  prison-movie type of way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah -- we'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swings the door open and exits, leaving Michael and  Cameron grinning at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU on a party invitation as it gets handed out.  "Future  Princeton Grad Bogey Lowenstein proudly presents a Saturd night bash at his abode.  Casual attire".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael holds the invitation up to Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it.  A golden opportunity.  Patrick can ask Katarina to the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that case, we'll need to make it a  school-wide blow out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will Bogey get bent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding?  He'll piss himself  with joy.  He's the ultimate kiss ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael hands a jock the party invite as they pass each  other at the trash cans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jock calls a fellow jock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jock whispers to a cheerleader

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cheerleader calls a White Rasta that she's making out with, showing him the invite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The White Rasta tells a cowboy as they run laps during tr practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cowboy Cells a Coffee Kid, as he shields his java fro the spray of the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey stands ac his open locker with Bianca.  The locker i an homage to Joey's "modeling" career.  Cheesy PRINT ADS him -- running in a field of daisies, petting a kitten, e -- adorn the locker door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which do you like better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT - HEADSHOTS of Joey.  In one, he's pouting in a wh shirt.  In the other, he's pouting in a black shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I like the white shirt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey nods thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Expensive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly  (beat) So, you going to Bogey Lowenbrau's  thing on Saturday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her his best flirtatious smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, 'cause I'm not gonna bother if  you won't be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He taps her on the nose and she giggles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca sits across from Cameron, who's transfixed, as alw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you heard about Bogey Lowenstein's  party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pouting) I really, really, really wanna go, but  I can't.  Not unless my sister goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm workin' on it. But she doesn't seem  to be goin' for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)  She's not a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lesbian?  No. I found a picture of  Jared Leto in one of her drawers, so I'm  pretty sure she's not harboring same-sex  tendencies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's the kind of guy she likes?  Pretty ones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows?  All I've ever heard her say  is that she'd dip before dating a guy  that smokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron furiously takes notes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  What else is she partial  to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick plays pool with some random deviant cronies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up when he hears a COMMOTION at the door.  LOU t bouncer is in the midst of throwing Michael and Cameron o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lou, it's okay.  They're with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lou looks at Patrick, surprised, then reluctantly lets ou two non-deviants pass through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick guides them to a table and sips from a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What've you got for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've retrieved certain pieces of  information on Miss Katarina Stratford I  think you'll find helpful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron pulls out a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Patrick)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One question before we start -- should you be drinking  alcohol when you don't have a liver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron looks up at Patrick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number one.  She hates smokers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a lung cancer issue

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her favorite uncle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead at forty-one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick sits up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you telling me I'm a -  (spits the word  out) "non-smoker"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another thing.  Bianca said that Kat  likes -- pretty guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is met with silence.  Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  You don't think I'm pretty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael smacks Cameron

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's pretty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!  I wasn't sure

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron goes back to the list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Okay -- Likes:  Thai food, feminist  prose, and "angry, stinky girl music of  the indie-rock persuasion".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what does that give me?  I'm  supposed to buy her some noodles and a  book and sit around listening to chicks  who can't play their instruments?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever been to Club Skunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gigglepuss is playing there tomorrow  night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make me do it, man

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assail your ears for one night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her favorite band.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick groans

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I also retrieved a list of her most  recent CD purchases, courtesy of  American Express.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Michael -- did you get this information  "illegally"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael puts a finger to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I prefer to think of it simply as an  alternative to what the law allows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm likin' you guys better

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down at the list of CDs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)  This is really music?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC BLARES in a room with minimalist decor splashed wit indie rock band posters and flyers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat and Mandella dance as they dress and apply make-up  Bianca enters, interrupting their fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you turn down the Screaming  Menstrual Bitches?  I'm trying to study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat doesn't move, so Bianca crosses to the stereo, turnin down the volume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Don't tell me you're actually going  out?  On a school night, no less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat shoots her a glare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing;  excited) Oh my God, does this mean you're  becoming normal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means that Gigglepuss is playing at  Club Skunk and we're going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Oh, I thought you might have a date (beat) I don't know why I'm bothering to ask,  but are you going to Bogey Lowenstein's  party Saturday night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're a freak.  I think you do  this to torture me.  And I think you  suck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles sweetly and shuts the door behind her.   Kat  doesn't bat an eye.  She grabs her purse and opens the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A happy black and white neon skunk sprays fine mist on th line of kids below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat and Mandella walk in, Mandella nervously pulling out fake ID.  The giant, afroed bouncer, BRUCE, looks typical mono-syllabic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering to Kat)  You think this'll work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach Bruce.  Kat puts on her happy, shiny face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Hello!  We'd like two for Gigglepuss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce looks the girls up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at their IDs. Mandella gently moves Kat aside,  wearing a face that could only be described as "I AM a  Victoria's Secret model."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet you can..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sticks out her chest and licks her lips.  Bruce stare at her deadpan and hands her back the IDs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. (to Mandella) And you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (all come hither) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy on the guys in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mandella winks at him and sashays inside   Kat: follows  behind, shaking her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick's mail truck clatters to a stop out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick walks up to Bruce, who's frisking a badly mowhawk PIERCED EYEBROW BOY.  Bruce pulls a SWITCHBLADE out of th boy's inside pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time, leave the Bic at home,  Skippy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bottle opener.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce pushes him inside the club, then sees Patrick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verona, my man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always a pleasure, Brucie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't have you pegged for a Gigglepuss  fan.  Aren't they a little too pre-teen  belly-button ring for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fan of a fan.  You see a couple of  minors come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Padua girls.  One tall, decent body.  The other one kinda short and  undersexed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just sent 'em through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick starts to go in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Hey -- what happened to that chick you  brought last time?  The one with the  snake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick laughs and goes into the club

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Onstage, the all-female band GIGGLEPUSS is parlaying thei bad girl sass into a ripping punk number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near the stage is a joyful mass of pogo-ing teens AT THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick bellies up and looks around the club. Gigglepuss  finishes a song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, out there.  We're Gigglepuss and  we're from Olympia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A teenage boy in the audience takes the opportunity to  scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pet my kitty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They rev into their next song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mandella and Kat glow with sweat.  When they hear the  opening chords of the song, they look at each other and  scream with glee as they begin to dance.  They couldn't b having a better time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick signals to get the bartender's attention and look across the bouncing surge of the crowd.  He spots Kat and Mandella singing along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gleeful Kat -- dancing and looking completely at ease None of her usual "attitude".  Patrick is transfixed.  An most definitely attracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEAR THE STAGE Kat looks at Mandella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) I need agua!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She makes her way through the crowd to the bar. AT THE BA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She made it.  She signals for the bartender and as she's  waiting, looks around.  She spots Patrick a few feet away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing to  herself)  Shit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sneaks a glance.  He's staring, but this time he look away before she can.  Despite herself, she's miffed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bartender arrives

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: (shouting)  What can I get you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two waters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Patrick again.  He's completely absorbed in band.  She scowls.  The bottled water arrives and she  marches off, forgetting to pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks up to Patrick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)  You're not fooling anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick looks at her, surprised

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)  hey.  Great show, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're planning on asking me out you might as well get over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)  Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) That's what you want, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling; gesturing  toward the band) Do you mind?  You're sort of ruining it  for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat steams.  And watches him watch the band

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) You're not surrounded by your usual  cloud of smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band takes a break, so they can stop yelling now

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  I quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans back, making no attempt to hit on her.  She move closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He motions toward the stage

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, these guys are no Bikini Kill  or The Raincoats, but they're right up  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who The Raincoats are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's completely taken aback.  He uses the moment to his  advantage and brushes her hair back as he speaks right in her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I watched you out there   I've never  seen you look like that

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat steps away, brushing the hair back that he just touch Her cheeks pinken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His cocky side is back in a flash

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)  Come to that party with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment, the band starts another SONG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)  What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bartender approaches.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: (to Kat, yelling)  You forgot to pay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)  I got it, Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses some bills on the bar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rather than thank him, Kat simply watches him, trying to  figure out his motive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing;  yelling)  Nine-thirty then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few people have gotten between them at the bar and she  can't hear a word he's saying.  She gives him one last lo and heads back into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick smiles.  She didn't say no this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd files out of the club, Kat and Mandella amongst them.  A^ they're walking toward the parking lot, Patrick coasts by in his truck.  The gears GRIND.  He yells out t window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mandella watches Kat as she stares after Patrick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has he importun'd you with love in  honourable fashion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat glances sharply at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; off  her look) Don't be Cruella with me.  I'm in favor  of romance.  You're the one that wants  to march on Washington every five  minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat pokes her, then looks back at the club dreamily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gigglepuss was so beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mandella nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were.  I only wish William could  have been here to witness the rebirth of  punk rock with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat links her arm through Mandella's and they head for th car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron and Michael are at Michael's locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, then she says that she almost  didn't wear the Kenneth Coles with that  dress because she thought she was  mixing, you know, genres. And the fact  that I noticed -- and I'm quoting here - "really meant something."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron looks At Michael expectantly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me that part already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I've just been going over the  whole thing in my head and -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey appears over Cameron's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  Dingo Boingo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron and Michael look at each other And turn around  slowly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; to  Michael) I hear you're helpin' Verona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh,  yeah.  We're old friend*

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Verona?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  We took bathes together when we  were kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's incredibly obvious that he's lying.  Joey eyes him t turns to Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your gig in all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just the new guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey turns back to Michael, grabbing the alligator on his shirt and twisting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better not fuck this up.  I'm  heavily invested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- it's all for the higher good  right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey lets go of Michael and SHOVES Cameron against a lock for good measure, as he walks away-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat sits outside waiting for her appointment, bored and  annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Miss Perky escorts Patrick out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're completely demented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheery) See you next week!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat stands and Patrick sees her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Perky watches in horror

dialogues.speaker: MISS PERKY
dialogues.text: You two know each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah/No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Perky grabs Kat and shoves her into her office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Patrick) Dear God, stay away from her.  If you  two ever decided to breed, evil would  truly walk the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick gives Kat one last look before the door shuts, th smiles-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are on, illuminating the yard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca and Chastity stand outside Kat's room.  MUSIC is  blaring and the door is shut.  Bianca looks at her watch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's obviously not going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the carpet, two pairs of teenage girl feet sneak  past.  Bianca and Chastity, teddy bear purses in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM THE KITCHEN A RUSTLING is heard.  The girls freeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter emerges from the kitchen with a mile-high sandwich The girls are like statues.  Walter jumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where're you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you must know, we were attempting to  go to a small study group of friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otherwise known as an orgy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a party. Daddy, but I knew  you'd forbid me to go since "Gloria  Steinem" over there isn't going --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to Kat -- Walkman blaring -- who comes  downstairs, wearing a baby tee and battered Levis.  Her  relaxing-at-home look is about 400 times sexier than her school look.  She wanders toward the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter directs his attention toward Kat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: That was a New Guinea Peaberry, you  Folger's-crystals-slurping-buttwipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just who I was looking for.

dialogues.text: (mocking) "I'm getting trashed, man." Isn't that  what you're supposed to do at a party?

dialogues.text: I say, do what you wanna do.

dialogues.text: Funny, you're the only one

dialogues.text: Cameron and Michael enter.  Cameron looks, around for his beloved, while Michael schmoozee with all in attendance a dishes dirt simultaneously.

dialogues.text: (high-fiving a  jock) Moose, my man!  (to Cameron) Ranked fifth in the state. Recruiters  have already started calling.

dialogues.text: (continuing;  grabbing his belt) Yo, Clem.  (to Cameron) A Patsy Cline fan, but hates the new  Leanne Rimes.  (with a Jamaican  swagger) Ziggy, peace, bra.  (to Cameron) Prefers a water pipe, but has been  known to use a bong.
