dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON BIANCA AND CHASTITY Bianca cranes her neck

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did he go?  He was just here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron walks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evening, ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca turns and graces him with a pained smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like things worked out tonight,  huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca ignores the question and tries to pawn him off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Chastity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe we share an art instructor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you mind getting me a drink,  Cameron?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly Pabst?  Old Milwaukee? RaiJieer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca gives him a tense smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprise me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads for the kitchen.  Joey walks up and grabs her  around the waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She giggles as he picks her up and carries her off -- jus as Cameron returns, a beer -- complete with a napkin and  straw -- in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity glares with a jealous fury after Bianca and Joey then gives Cameron the once-over and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extremely unfortunate maneuver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell is that?  What kind of 'guy  just picks up a girl and carries her  away while you're talking to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buttholus extremus.  But hey, you're  making progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I ' m not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smacks himself in the head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) She used me!  She wants to go out with  Dorsey.  Not me.  I'm an idiot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael pats him on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least you're self-aware

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat and a crowd of White Rastas and Cowboys stand in a  drunken group hug singing "I Shot the Sheriff".  Kat has  another shot glass in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick is showing a scar to an inebriated, enraptured  cheerleader.  He looks up at Kat and smiles meets his eye then looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca stands next to Joey, sipping from her beer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So yeah, I've got the Sears catalog  thing going -- and the tube sock gig "  that's gonna be huge.  And then I'm up  for an ad for Queen Harry next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a gay cruise line, but I'll be,  like, wearing a uniform and stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca tries to appear impressed, but it's getting  difficult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My agent says I've got a good shot at  being the Prada guy next year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over her shoulder and waves at someone.  Bianca  takes the opportunity to escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca shuts the door and leans on it with a sigh.  Chast applies lip-gloss in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He practically proposed when he found  out we had the same dermatologist. I  mean. Dr. Bonchowski is great an all,  but he's not exactly relevant party  conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he oily or dry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Combination.  I don't know -- I thought  he'd be different.  More of a  gentleman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity rolls her eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca, I don't think the highlights of  dating Joey Dorsey are going to include  door-opening and coat-holding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I wonder if the guys we're  supposed to want to go out with are the  ones we actually want to go out with,  you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I know is -- I'd give up my private  line to go out with a guy like Joey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a KNOCK at the door.  Bianca opens it to find a v drunken Kat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca, I need to talk to you -- I need  to tell you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting her off) I really don't think I need any social  advice from you right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca grabs Chastity's arm and they exit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick tries to remove a shot glass from Kat's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should let me have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat is fierce in her refusal to let go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want another one

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey enters, grabbing Patrick by the shoulder, distractin him from his task.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My man

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Patrick turns, Kat breaks free and dives into the sea dancing people in the dining room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) It's about time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deal's a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He peels off some bills

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) How'd you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her to act like a human

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very drunken Kat jumps up onto the kitchen island and  starts dancing by herself.  She lets loose, hair flying.  She's almost burlesque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Others form a crowd, clapping and cheering her on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She swings her head around BANGING it on a copper pot  hanging from the rack above the center island.  She start to sway, then goes down as Patrick rushes over to catch h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others CLAP, thinking this is a wonderful finale.  Patrick sets her down on her feet, holding her up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. I'm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to push him away, but staggers when she does gr her again, bracing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need to lie down for awhile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, uh. You lie down and you'll go to  sleep

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, just let me sleep

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if you have a concussion? My dog  went to sleep with a concussion and woke  up a vegetable. Not that I could tell  the difference...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to sit on the floor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll just sleep but stay awake,  okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls her back to her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, let's walk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Patrick walks Kat through the dining room, Cameron  gr his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON We need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron, I'm a little busy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's off. The whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat slides down to the floor and Patrick struggles to  ge back on her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What 're you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's partial to Joey, not me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick doesn't have time for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron -- do you like the girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatient) Then, go get her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick continues walking an oblivious Kat outside. Camer stands there, unsure how to make use of this advice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick marches Kat around the yard, holding her up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so patronizing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave it to you to use big words when  you're shitfaced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why 're you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't care if I die

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because then I'd have to start taking  out girls who like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you could find one

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that?  Who needs affection when  I've got blind hatred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let me sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks her over to the swingset and plops her down in a swing, moving her hands to hang onto the chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits and looks at him for a moment with a smile. Then FALLS over backward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Jesus.  You're like a weeble

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick rushes to right her, then starts pushing her on t swing to keep her entertained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Why'd you let him get to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorsey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  It'd have to be a pretty big  deal to get you to mainline tequila. You  don't seem like the type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up a  drunken head) Hey man. . .  You don ' t think I can  be "cool"?  You don't think I can be  "laid back" like everyone else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly  sarcastic) I thought you were above all that

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what they say

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops the swing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. What do they say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat is asleep, her head resting against the swing's chain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drags her to her feet and starts singing loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Jingle Bells! Jingle Belles! Wake up  damn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits her down on the slide and shakes her like a rag  doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Kat! Wake up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waking) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sighs with relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share some meaningful eye contact. And then she PUKE on his shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat washes her face and grabs a bottle of Scope, taking a big swig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KNOCK sounds at the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca opens the door and looks at her sister with the  smuggest of all possible grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner taste better on the way out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gives her a "don't even start" look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I don't get you.  You act like you're  too good for any of this, and then you  go totally apeshit when you get here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes past her and leaves the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat's in the driver's seat.  Patrick leans in and takes t keys out of the ignition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids loiter on the lawn.  Bianca and Chastity walk outsid Joey catches up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bunch of us are going to Jaret's  house.  Wanna come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity looks at Bianca, who wears a pained expression. She looks at her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to be home in twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eagerly, to Joey) I don't have to be home 'til two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, c'mon. (to Bianca) Maybe next time --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head back into the party, leaving an astonished Bian

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron exits the party and stops when he sees Bianca  standing alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly  accusatory) Have fun tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tons

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to walk on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Cameron?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops. She gives him a helpless smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Do you think you could give me a ride  home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick drives as Kat sits in the passenger seat, fiddlin with the radio dial.  She finds a SONG she's happy with a Patrick quickly changes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm driving, so I get to pick the  tunes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She changes it back to her song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He changes it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm in control of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's Gigglepuss - I know you like  them.  I saw you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick doesn't have an answer for this, so he let's her  listen to her song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) When you were gone last year -- where  were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you in jail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you weren't

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why'd you ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you lie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't answer, but instead, frowns and turns up the  music.  She bobs her head drunkenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I should do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to the radio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start a band?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) My father wouldn't approve of that that

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't strike me as the type that  would ask permission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so now you think you know me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gettin' there

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice loses it's venom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing people know about me is  that I'm "scary".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to look at her -- she looks anything but scary  right now.  He tries to hide his smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah -- well, I'm no picnic myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They eye each other, sharing a moment of connection,  realizing they're both created the same exterior for  themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick pulls into her driveway and shuts off the motor. looks up at her house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) So what ' s up with your dad?  He a  pain in the ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just wants me to be someone I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No offense, but you're sister is  without.  I know everyone likes her and  all, but ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat stares at him with new admiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know -- you're not as vile as I  thought you were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans drunkenly toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their faces grow closer as if they're about to kiss And t Patrick turns away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I'll see you in school

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat stares at him, pissed.  Then gets out of the car,  SLAMMING the door shut behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca and Cameron ride in silence. He finally breaks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I looked for you back at the party, but  you always seemed to be "occupied".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faux-innocence ) I was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never wanted to go out with 'me,  did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca bites her lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctant) Well, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then that's all you had to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always been this selfish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIANCA thinks a minute

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls up in front of the house

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because you're beautiful, doesn't  mean you can treat people like they  don't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him for a moment -- then grabs his face and  gives him a kiss on the lips.  He draws back in surprise, then kisses her back.  She smiles, then gets out of the c without another word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron grins and drives away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) And I'm back in the saddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat sits at her desk, burying her face in a book as the  others enter.  The White Rastas are first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat, my lady, you sway to the rhythm of  my heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her hand and kisses it as she pulls it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLEM, a cowboy, enters, high-fiving Derek with new-found  friendliness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yippe kai-aye, bra.  (to Kat) Dance for me, cowgirl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits next to Derek

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Okay, now tell me again why he didn't  shoot the deputy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because the deputy meant him no harm,  my friend.  It was only the sheriff that  was the oppressor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey saunters in and takes his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat, babe, you were on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Blaise enters and sits at her desk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well now, did everyone have a good  weekend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should ask Verona

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick enters, late, and slinks to his desk.  Kat looks down and around, everywhere but at Patrick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Blaise tries to remember what she's supposed to talk about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay then.  Well. (beat) Oh, yes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She clears her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'd like you all to write your own  version of Shakespeare's Sonnet #141.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Any form you'd like.  Rhyme, no rhyme,  whatever.  I'd like to see you elaborate  on his theme, however. Let's read it  aloud, shall we? Anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class is frozen in apathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Derek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Blaise hands him the sonnet. He shifts uncomfortably his seat. Then grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading; in his  Rasta stoner drawl) In faith, I do not love thee with mine  eyes/ For they in thee a thousand errors  note/ But 'tis my heart that loves what  they despise/ Who in despite of view is  pleas 'd to dote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back of the room Clem raises his hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Blaise, can I get the bathroom  pass?  Damn if Shakespeare don't act as  a laxative on my person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat and Mandella scrape the peanuts out of their sauce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You went to the party?  I thought we  were officially opposed to suburban  social activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't have a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't have a choice?  Where's Kat  and what have you done with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did Bianca a favor and it backfired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got drunk.  I puked.  I got rejected.   It was big fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick enters, walking to the counter to order. He sees and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gathers her things and bolts out the door.  Patrick  looks at Mandella, who shrugs and follows Kat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. BIOLOGY CLASS - DAY Cameron and Michael flank Patric at his lab table

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you got cozy with she who stings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - I've got a sweet-payin' job that  I'm about to lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you do to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don ' t know.  (beat) I decided not to nail her when she was  too drunk to remember it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and Cameron look at each other in realization, th turn back to Patrick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You realize this puts the whole operation in peril.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit.  She won't even look at me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't you just tell her you're sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick's expression says that this is not a possibility. Michael makes a time out sign with his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mandella is at her locker.  Drawings of William Shakespea adorn the door.  She looks at them with a sigh, then ties her silk scarf tightly around her neck, in an attempt to off her air supply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there.  Tired of breathing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shyly, as she  loosens the scarf) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool pictures.  You a fan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICHAEL rocks.  Very hip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him suspiciously

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who could refrain that had a heart to  love and in that heart, courage to make  ' B love known?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael thinks for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macbeth, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happily stunned) Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat a fan, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled) Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans in close to her, conspiratorially

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, listen... I have this friend

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron sits next to Patrick on the bleachers as they wat Kat's practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hates you with the fire of a  thousand suns .  That's a direct quote

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just needs time to cool off I'll  give it a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PUCK flies at them from the field, narrowly missing the heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Maybe two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You makin' any headway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kissed me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyebrow raised) Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity rounds the corner and bends down to get a drink  from the water fountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey stands talking to two JOCK COHORTS.  The guys don't her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk to me about the sweetest  date.  That little halo Bianca is gonna  be prone and proven on prom night.  Six  virgins in a row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cohorts chortle Chastity keeps drinking from the  fountain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey leans against Patrick's Jeep.  Patrick is inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Dorsey. ..the limo.-the  flowers.  Another hundred for the tux --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough with the Barbie n' Ken shit. I  know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls out his wallet and hands Patrick a wad of money

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Take it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick does, with a smile, as he ROARS out of the parkin lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat and Mandella deface a prom flyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you even imagine?  Who the hell  would go to this a bastion of commercial  excess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess we're not, since we don't  have dates .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to you!  You sound like Betty,  all pissed off because Archie is taking  Veronica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, we won't go.  It's not like  I have a dress anyway

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ' re looking at this from the wrong  perspective.  We're making a statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unconvinced) Oh, good.  Something new and different  for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chapin patrols as boys and girls shoot arrows at targ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey swaggers up to Bianca, who is taking careful aim.  Chastity watches from across the row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, sweet cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not looking at  him) Hi, Joey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're concentrating awfully hard  considering it's gym class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lets the arrow go and turns to look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Listen, I want to talk to you about the  prom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the deal.  I can ' t go if Kat  doesn't go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background, a RASTA crumples to the ground.  Hit A casualty of Gym.  Mr. Chapin scurries over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your sister is going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca looks at him, surprised

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey takes the bow and arrow from Bianca's hand.  He draw back and takes aim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity looks over from her spot on the field, but keeps lips firmly shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat browses through the feminist lit section Patrick appears, through a hole in the books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, have you seen The Feminine  Mystique?  I lost my copy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frowning) What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard there was a poetry reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You 're so --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleasant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat stares at him, deadpan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Wholesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unwelcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unwelcome?  I guess someone still has  her panties in a twist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't for one minute think that you had  any effect whatsoever on my panties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what did I have an effect on ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other than my upchuck reflex? Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes past him and heads out the' door Pat looks down at the book he's been holding in his hand: Taming of the Shrew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron  and Michael flank Patrick as he shovels food int mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right. She's still pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet love, renew thy force!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man -- don't say shit like that to  me.  People can hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated) You humiliated the woman! Sacrifice   yourself on the altar of dignity and   even the score.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best case scenario, you're back on the  payroll for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the worst?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick  thinks for a minute

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I go down. I'm takin' her with me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat and the other students sit at their desks, taking a q Patrick's seat is conspicuously empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From outside, we hear the soft, unsure beginnings of a SO Kat looks up, then out the window, HORRIFIED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song grows louder until we realize it's The Partridge Family's "I Think I Love You".  Being sung by Patrick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "This morning, I woke up with this  feeling, I didn't know how to deal with,  and so I just decided to myself--"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STUDENTS rush to the window. OUTSIDE Patrick stands  beneath the window, crooning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scurvy is next to him, keeping the beat on the bongos and doing backup vocal s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I'd hide it to myself.  And never talk  about it.  And didn't I go and shout it  when you walked into the room --"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes quite a sarcastic show of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Blaise touches her heart, as if the song is for her. Kat slowly walks to the window, peeking below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick smiles at her as he finishes the verse with a big finale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) " I think I love you I "

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other students laugh, clap, cheer, etc. Kat sinks dow mortified, but with a slight smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick and several other miscreants sit quietly, mulling over their misfortune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice song, Verona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flog me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes the appropriate hand gesture

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chapin, the gym teacher, sits at the desk in front,  ignoring them while he reads a girly weightlifting magazi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Mr. Chapin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick looks up at the sound of her voice and sees Kat  standing in the doorway.  She gives him a smile and he pe up a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat walks into the room and addresses Mr. Chapin again. H turns fully to face her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I'd like to state for the record  that Mr. Verona ' s current  incarceration is unnecessary.  I never  filed a complaint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't have to.  He disrupted a  classroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat glances over at Patrick and motions her head toward t window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick shrugs, not knowing what she ' s talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She motions again, and looks toward the window with an  expression that says, "Make a break for it, moron."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat brings her attention back to Mr. Chapin while Patrick inches out of his seat toward the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other miscreants watch with glee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Mr. Chapin, I hardly think a  simple serenade warrants a week of  detention.  There are far more hideous  acts than off-key singing being  performed by the student body on a  regular basis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick is halfway out the window now.  And none too happ about it, considering they're on the second floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He eyes a large TREE a few feet away from MR. CHAPIN.  He starts to turn away from Kat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna change my mind, Kat.  Rules stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat starts to panic, as Patrick has yet to make the jump the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, Mr. Chapin.  There's something  I've always wanted to show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back toward her again, the very second before he would have spotted Patrick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat glances toward the window.  Patrick's just about to m the jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind, we see her lift up her shirt and flash her b at Mr. Chapin, just as Patrick makes the Jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The miscreants cheer, for both the daring' escape and the flash of skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chapin reddens and tries to be stern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to let that slide, Katarina.   But if I catch you doing that again,  you'll be in here with the rest of these  guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He motions to the remaining detention prisoners, without  noticing Patrick's absence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. Chapin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat bolts out the door.  Mr. Chapin goes back to his musc mag, wiping the sweat from his brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat arrives at the tree. looking around breathlessly, see no one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He left!  I sprung the dickhead and he  cruised on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look up, sunshine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does.  He's still in the tree

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I never told you I'm afraid of  heights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) C'mon.  It's not that bad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try lookin' at it from this angle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She assesses the branch structure

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your right foot there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.  I'm stayin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to climb up and show you  how to get down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice trembling) Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sighs and dose so.  When she gets to his level, she  perches on the branch next to him.  He grins at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then swings himself down with the grace and ease of a  monkey, leaving her sitting there, realizing she's been  duped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She climbs down after him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick and Kat walk amongst the games

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Partridge Family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured it had to be something  ridiculous to win your respect.  And  piss you off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how'd you get Chapin to look the  other way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dazzled him with my wit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops and picks up a toy gun that SHOOTS water at  giggling hyenas and wails on it.  The barker hands her a  stuffed animal as her prize.  She hands it to the small K next to her and they continue walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) A soft side? Who knew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, don't let it get out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's your excuse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acting the way we do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like to do what people expect.   Then they expect it all the time and  they get disappointed when you change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if you disappoint them from the  start, you're covered?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you screwed up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never disappointed me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She blushes under his gaze

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You up for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For. . . ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He motions to the SIGN for a paint-ball game. She grins

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two of them creep through the paint-ball course,  stealthy and full of the desire to best the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick nails Kat in the back with a big glob of red pain Kat gets him in the chest with a glob of blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick returns fire with a big yellow splat to the side her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat squirts a green shot to his forehead After a few more shots, they're both covered in paint

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to shoot him again, only to find that her gun i empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Damn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick grabs her in a victorious tackle.  They land,  laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard to even recognize them, as their hair and faces are so smeared with paint globs, but they still manage to find each other's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wipes a smear of blue paint away from her lips,  as he goes to kiss her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEARBY The kid with the stuffed animal, points

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Mom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His mother hurries him away. What's started as a tackle h turned into a passionate kiss

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick pulls up in Kat's driveway.  Their paint wardrobe has dried by now and they look like refugees from some  strange, yet colorful, war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: State trooper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The duck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearsay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the porn career's a lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shuts off the car and turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her neck.  It tickles.  She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me something true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate peas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- something real.  Something no one  else knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in-between kisses) You're sweet.  And sexy.  And  completely hot for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one else knows

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're amazingly self-assured. Has  anyone ever told you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to the prom with me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat's smile disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a request or a command?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I won't go with you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I don't want to. It's a stupid  tradition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick sits quietly, torn. He can't very well tell her h being paid to take her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People won't expect you to go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat turns to him, getting angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of it -- what's in it for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits silently, not looking at her, confirming her  suspicions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Create a little drama?  Start a new  rumor?  What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I have to have a motive to be with  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need therapy.  Has anyone ever told  you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Answer the question, Patrick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) Nothing!  There's nothing in it for me.   Just the pleasure of your company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out a cigarette.  She breaks it in half before s SLAMS the car door and walks into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick PEELS out of the driveway. Kat turns at the front door and watches him go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick pulls up to a stop light and waits for .the green

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances over at A DRUNKEN HOMELESS GUY in the median, has decided that he doesn't need to wear pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick pulls out his wallet, takes the wad of money Joey gave him and hands it to the homeless guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cover that up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light turns green and Patrick pulls away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat stands at the sink, scrubbing paint off of her face  Bianca TAPS on the open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick question -- are you going to the  prom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat pushes the door shut with a SLAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron and Bianca sit together at their study cubby.  Sh fingers a strand of her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Guillermo says, "If you go any  lighter, you're gonna look like an extra  on 90210."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca stares at him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: do you listen to this crap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What crap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me.  This endless ...blonde babble. I'm  like, boring myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God!  If I had to hear one more  story about your coiffure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He mock stabs himself with a pencil as she giggles and  smacks his hand away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I figured you'd get to the good stuff  eventually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What good stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "real you".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like my fear of wearing pastels?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks stricken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'm kidding.  (beat) You know how sometimes you just become  this "persona"?  And you don't know how  to quit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter of fact) No

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay -- you're gonna need to learn how  to lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mandella struggles with the lock on her locker.  Finally, opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanging inside is a beautiful DRESS, inspired by the 16th Century.  Mandella slowly unpins a NOTE from the dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mandella's agog.  Trevor walks by and sees her holding th dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna look splendiferous in  that, Mandella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mandella looks up sharply, shaken from her reverie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) that's cool to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mandella grins It is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharon is at her computer, Walter at his exercise bike

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you rather be ravished by a  pirate or a British rear admiral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pirate -- no question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca enters and walks over to Walter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, I want to discuss the prom with  you. It's tomorrow night --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prom?  Kat has a date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's that hot rod Joey, right? That ' s  who you want me to bend my rules for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not a "hot rod".  Whatever that  is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going unless your sister  goes.  End of story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  I see that I'm a prisoner in my  own house.  I'm not a daughter. I'm a  possession!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca storms out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) You know what happens at proms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharon stops her typing and looks up at Walter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll dance, they'll kiss, they'll  come home.  Let her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kissing?  Is that what you think  happens?  Kissing isn't what keeps me up  to my elbows in placenta all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca lies on her bed.  MTV blares.  A KNOCK sounds.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat enters and sits down on the bed, muting the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kindly) Listen, I know you hate having to sit  home because I'm not Susie High School.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do care. But I'm a firm believer in  doing something for your own reasons,  not someone else ' s .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I had that luxury. I'm the only  sophomore that got asked to the prom and  I can't go, because you won ' t.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat clears her throat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey never told you we went out, did  he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In 9th.  For a month

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (self-mocking) He was, like, a total babe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you hate Joey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I do.  Back then, was a different  story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said everyone was doing it.  So I  did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing on) Just once.  Afterwards, I told him I  didn't want to anymore.  I wasn't ready.   He got pissed.  Then he broke up with  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca stares at her, dumbfounded

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After that, I swore I'd never do  anything just because "everyone else"  was doing it.  And I haven't since.  Except for Bogey's party, and my  stunning gastro-intestinal display --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to let you make up your own  mind about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. you didn't!  If you really thought  I could make my own decisions, you  would've let me go out with him instead  of helping Daddy hold me hostage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat stands up slowly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not stupid enough to repeat your  mistakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I thought I was protecting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, you're just like him! Just keep me  locked away in the dark, so I can't  experience anything for myself

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not all experiences are good, Bianca.  You can't always trust the people you  want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'll never know, will I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rises and holds the door open for Kat, then slams it  behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sprinkler cruises the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat lies in bed, staring at the ceiling.  She rolls over picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca, still in her pajamas, eats a bowl of cereal while watching "I Love Lucy" reruns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KNOCK sounds

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat opens the door and peers in with a grin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel like shopping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca looks up, hopefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Sharon are in front of the television.  Walter has the TV Guide in hand, glasses on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you wanna watch?  We've got  crap, crap, crap or crap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Ruth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca walks into the living room.  She's wearing a prom  dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mommy. (looking away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter scurries takes off his glasses and looks from Bian to Sharon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you look beautiful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like?  My date should be here in  five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm missing something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a date, Daddy.  And he ' s not a  captain of oppression like some men we  know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOORBELL RINGS.  Bianca runs to open it.  There stand CAMERON.  He takes in Bianca's outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter rises.  Sharon pulls him back down on the couch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bianca) Have a great time, honey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But -- who -- what --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door SLAMS.  As Sharon looks at Walter with a grin, a blur rushes down the stairs and out the door.  The blur h Kat ' s voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, guys. I'm going to the prom. See  you in a few.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door SLAMS again.  Walter and Sharon 'are alone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What just happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your daughters went to the prom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I have anything to say about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ' s what I thought

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOORBELL RINGS again. Walter opens it to find Joey on the porch, wearing a tux.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to pick up Bianca.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: late

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SLAMS the door shut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat pulls up in her car, emerging resplendent in an ice  gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick sits on the steps, waiting.  In a tux.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get a tux at the last minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Scurvy's.  His date got convicted.   Where'd you get the dress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just something I had.  You know

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Oh huh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm  -- sorry -- that I  questioned your motives.  I was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick winces slightly, but covers it with a smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No prob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He remains seated.  Kat fidgets nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rises and stares at her, taking in her image  appreciatively.  She blushes and turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) C'mon.  Let's get this over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hotel ballroom transformed into a fantasy world.  Patri and Kat enter, Kat attempting to deny the romance of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite the ostentatious display

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cowboy two-steps by them, dragging some poor girl aroun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Clem even wore his good boots

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat steps forward, looking around and spots Cameron and  Bianca dancing cheek to cheek.  She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mandella enters nervously, in the long Elizabethan gown,  hair piled on top of her head.  She spots Kat and hurries over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William - he asked me to meet him here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, honey -- tell me we haven't'  progressed to full-on hallucinations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick looks toward the door and taps Kat.  She turns an points Mandella the same way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael - in full Shakespearean dress with a new goatee o his chin - bows in their direction. Mandella's grin could be bigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael swashbuckles over to them, taking Mandella's hand and leading her onto the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mi' lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Patrick) Good sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat and Patrick dance to a slow SONG.  Whatever he's  whispering into her ear is making her laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cam and Bianca dance nearby, glowing with happiness. She  whispers something in his ear and heads for the ladies' r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca walks in, positively radiant. Chastity emerges fro stall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity checks her hair in the mirror,  aloof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you ' re the only sophomore  at the prom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity maintains her snooty tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just so you know, my date isn't  planning on spending most of the night  in his backseat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIANCA What're you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey Dorsey is only after one thing - -  your cherry. He practically made a  public announcement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appalled, Bianca storms out. Chastity  tries to backpedal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I wanted to tell you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey, drunk, disorderly and pissed off, walks in with a f stray jocks - also dateless.  He zeroes in on Cameron, no consoling a pissed-off Bianca.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick and Kat continue to slow dance, oblivious to the  evil about to erupt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My grandmother's .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where I was last year.  She'd  never lived alone -- my grandfather died  -- I stayed with her.  I wasn't in jail,  I don't know Marilyn Manson, and I've  never slept with a Spice Girl.  I spent  a year sitting next to my grandma on the  couch watching Wheel of Fortune.  End of  story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a breath and looks away, not meeting her eyes. K stares at him for a moment and laughs a delighted laugh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ' s completely adorable!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It gets worse -- you still have your  freshman yearbook?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's interrupted by Joey's hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Bianca doing here with that  cheese dick?  I didn't pay you to let  some little punk ass snake me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael spots the altercation and dances Mandella over to Cameron and Bianca.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cameron) Feces hitting fan.  C'mon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael takes Cameron aside, leaving Mandella and Bianca  staring after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and Cameron approach Joey as he continues to taun Patrick who keeps quiet, realizing the weight of this  situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Joey, pal, compadre.  Let's take it  easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey turns toward Michael and Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY You two are in big trouble

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron faces Joey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admit it.  You lost.  Be a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey PUNCHES Cameron in the face, taking him by surprise  Cameron holds his nose as it bleeds onto his tux

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The various cliques descend angrily and Joey is soon  surrounded by seething Cowboys, Coffee Kids and White  Rastas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very uncool, my brother

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not your brother, white boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other Rastas GASP, as if stung by the realization tha they're white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey turns back to Patrick and Kat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Just so you know -- she'll only spread  her legs once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat looks from Joey to Patrick, not sure what she's heari Joey pushes through the crowd but a HAND drags him back.  It's Bianca.  And she BELTS the hell out of him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's for making my date bleed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She BELTS him again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) That's for my sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And AGAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) And that's for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cliques now descend on Joey, punching him wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's for the fourth grade,  asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAT runs down the stairs, Patrick chasing her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were paid to take me out!  By --  the one person I truly hate.  I knew it  was a set-up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  What was it like?  A down  payment now, then a bonus for sleeping  with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't care about the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He catches up to her now

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I cared about --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to face him with a countenance more in sorrow t in anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so not what I thought you were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her and kisses her to shut her up.  After a seco she jerks away and flees down the stairs and out of sight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca stands at the top of the stairs, watching.  She's  never looked more guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat is sprawled on the couch in sweats, wrapped in a  blanket, watching "Sixteen Candles".  When Molly Ringwald leans across the birthday cake to get a kiss from her dre date, Kat changes the channel disgustedly, settling for a infomercial

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone sits next to her.  Not ringing.  Bianca breezes in, bearing a cup of tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you don't want to come  with us?  It'll be fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat takes the tea and gives a weak smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ' m sure .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca sits down next to her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You looked beautiful last night, you  know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca gives her a squeeze, then jumps up when the DOORBE rings, opening the door to a waiting Cameron.  He peeks h head inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door shuts behind her as Walter enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that your sister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  She left with some bikers Big  ones.  Full of sperm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sits down on the arm of the chair and watches the  infomercial with Kat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I don't understand the allure of  dehydrated food.  Is this something I  should be hip to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dreading the  answer) So tell me about this dance. Was it  fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parts of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which parts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The part where Bianca beat the hell out  of some guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca did what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?  Upset that I rubbed  off on her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat looks up in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You know, fathers don't like to admit  that their daughters are capable of  running their own lives.  It means we've  become spectators.  Bianca still lets me  play a few innings.  You've had me on  the bleachers for years.  When you go to  Sarah Lawrence, I won't even be able to  watch the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopeful) When I go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ.  Don't tell me you've  changed your mind.  I already sent 'em a  check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat reaches over and gives him a hug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. CAFETERIA - DAY Kat stands grabs a box of cornflakes from the food line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katarina?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and looks at him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to express my apologies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking down) I didn't mean for you to get -- When  Bianca asked me to find you a boyfriend,  I had no idea it would turn out so --  ugly. I would never have  done anything  to compromise your - - -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He trails off when he realizes she's thrown her food tray against the wall and marched off -- the old "kill, kill"  look back in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat stomps up the hallway, full of menace

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca's English teacher perches on the edge of a desk, o book in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who can tell me at what point Lucentio  admits his deception?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door of the classroom FLIES open and an angry Kat sta in, yanking Bianca from her chair and dragging her toward the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the teacher) Family emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca tries to pull away as Kat drags her by the hair  between two rows of lockers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You set me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? To completely damage me?  To send  me to therapy forever? What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I just wanted

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Perky walks up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies?  Shall we take a trip to my  office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Perky stares at both sisters as they sit before her, then focuses on Bianca.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're the real bitch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!  Okay?  Yes -- I'm the real bitch.   I wanted her to get a boyfriend so I  could.  Apparently, this makes me a  horrible person.  I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to Kat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I swear -- I didn't know about the  money.  I didn't even know Joey was  involved.  I would never intentionally  hurt you, Kat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kat) Do you care to respond?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I supposed to feel better? Like,  right now?  Or do I have some time to  think about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just smack her now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca rises, taking Kat by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Miss Perky) We'll be getting back to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, no hug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Bianca leave Miss Perky's office

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that woman a complete fruit-loop or  is it just me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Blaise faces the class

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  I'm assuming everyone found  time to compose, their poems. Except for  Mr. Dorsey, who's still in ICU.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nerds in the back high-five each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Would anyone care to read theirs aloud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one moves.  Then Kat slowly stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'11 go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She downs a couple Prozac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Please proceed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat stands, puts on her glasses, and takes a deep breath  before reading from her notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate the way you talk to me/ and the  way you cut your hair/ I hate the way  you drive my car/ I hate it when you  stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pauses, then continues

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I hate your big dumb combat boots/ and  the way you read my mind/ I hate you so  much it makes me sick/ it even makes me  rhyme.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a deep breath, and looks quickly at Patrick, wh stares at the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I hate the way you're always right/ I  hate it when you lie/ I hate it when you  make me laugh/ even worse when you make  me cry/ I hate it that you're not  around/ and the fact that you didn't  call/ But mostly I hate the way I don '  t hate you/ not even close, not even a  little bit, not even any at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks directly at Patrick.  He looks back this time. The look they exchange says everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she walks out of the room The rest of the class rema in stunned silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat walks to her car alone. When she opens the door, she' greeted with a Fender Stratocaster guitar, reclining in t front seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks it up slowly, inspecting every detail, then spi around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick stands there, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Fender Strat. You bought this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you could use it. When you  start your band.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't answer, but hides a smile, so he walks  close

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Besides, I had some extra cash. Some  asshole paid me to take out a really  great girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but then I fucked up. I fell for  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blushes and looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You know -- it's not every day you find  a girl who'll flash her tits to get you  out of detention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks up. surprised and embarrassed that he found out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her upturned face as a sign to kiss her and he d She lets him this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then breaks it off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't just buy me a guitar every  time you screw up, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He quiets her with another kiss Which she breaks off agai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't just think you can

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her again, not letting her end it this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the sounds of MUSIC and LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick is at the barbecue grill, flipping burgers.  Kat  watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is my veggie burger the only burnt  object on this grill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I like to torture you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Bianca?  Can you get me my freshman  yearbook?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don ' t you even dare. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON BIANCA AND CAMERON As they argue on the patio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do to!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rises to get the yearbook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can someone please tell her that  sunflower seeds come from sunflowers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Severely making-out in a lawn chair.  She comes up for a  breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't remember a word of Shakespeare  right now. Isn't that weird?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael pulls her back down for another round ON KAT AND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to keep him from grabbing the yearbook that Bia now hands her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're freaked over this, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca hands her the yearbook

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's more than freaked.  He's froke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flips to a page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to call your attention to  Patrick Verona's stunning bad-ass look  of 1995 ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT - A horrifically nerdy freshman year picture Glass bad hair, headgear -- the works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds up the picture for all to view. Patrick cringes and throws a handful of pretzels at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick -- is that- a.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask my attorney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat and Bianca huddle over the picture, giggling --  as w CRANE UP and hear a GIRLY PUNK version of The Partridge  Family's "I Think I Love You".
